snippet: Ten days of interviews and front-line visits made clear that an alliance entrusted with beating jihadists in northern Syria faces daunting political and logistical challenges.
abstract: New alliance backed by United States to train and arm Syrian rebels to fight Islamic State is faltering; group is dominated by ethnic Kurdish militias, which are mostly inexperienced, poorly equipped and disorganized; interviews and front-line visits reveal that Kurds and Arabs fighting ISIS face big political and logistical hurdles.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Ten days of interviews and front-line visits made clear that an alliance entrusted with beating jihadists in northern Syria faces daunting political and logistical challenges.

headline.main: New U.S.-Backed Alliance to Counter ISIS in Syria Falters
headline.print_headline: New U.S. Alliance to Counter ISIS Falters in Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
